meanings.definition: A chief or leader of a Native American tribe in the Caribbean or Central America.
meanings.sent1: The caziques gathered their people for an important meeting.
meanings.sent2: The caziques of the tribe made decisions together.
meanings.sent3: The caziques decided to have a dance-off to settle disputes.
meanings.sent4: The caziques stood tall like ancient trees, guiding their tribe.
meanings.sent5: The caziques wore elaborate headdresses to signify their leadership.

meanings.definition: The title given to such a chief or leader.
meanings.sent1: The young warrior aspired to become a caziques one day.
meanings.sent2: The caziques was respected by all for their wisdom.
meanings.sent3: The children played a game pretending to be caziques of their own imaginary tribe.
meanings.sent4: The caziques' authority was unquestioned among the people.
meanings.sent5: The caziques' name echoed through the valleys, a symbol of power.
